summary: The 'Forum Accountability and Integrity in Roadway Trucking Act' (FAIR Trucking Act) amends U.S. Code Title 28 to grant federal district courts original jurisdiction over highway accident lawsuits involving interstate motor carriers.  It sets a minimum controversy value of $5,000,000 for these cases and specifies citizenship requirements for plaintiffs and defendants to establish federal jurisdiction. The bill aims to establish a specific venue for legal disputes arising from commercial truck accidents.
